questions.question: Which of the following is a false statement?

choices.answer: The Twin towers were each 110 stories tall.
The Twin Towers were easy to see in the Manhattan skyline.
The Twin Towers were apartments only, no office spaces.
You could see into New Jersey from the top floors.

questions.question: Which of the following describes the correct order of events?

choices.answer: bin Laden founded Al Qaeda, 9/11 attacks, US goes to war
US goes to war, 9/11 attacks, bin Laden founded Al Qaeda
9/11 attacks, bin Laden founded Al Qaeda, US goes to war
bin Laden founded Al Qaeda, US goes to war, 9/11 attacks

questions.question: On live TV, millions of people saw ______________

choices.answer: Osama bin Laden killed in Pakistan
a hijacked plane crash into the White House
the collapse of the South Tower
the bombing of the World Trade Center in 1993
It crashed into the White House
It crashed into the Capitol
After it was hijacked, the pilot regained control.
After hijacking, passengers took control and crashed plane.

questions.question: What happened seconds after the first plane hit the North Tower?

choices.answer: a second hijacked plane hit the South Tower.
Police, firefighters and EMTs were sent to the scene.
The FFA banned all flights from taking off.
The North Tower collapsed.

questions.question: Which of the following is a true statement?

choices.answer: Osama bin Laden was kiled in Pakistan in 2011.
The United States is still searching for bin Laden.
Osama bin Laden was killed on September 11, 2001.
The Taliban handed over bin Laden on September 20, 2001.
a terrorist group created in late 1980s in Afghanistan
another word for the Taliban
another word for ISIS
another word for "jihad" or holy war

questions.question: Which of the following is a true statement?

choices.answer: The 19 hijackers were from Afghanistan
The 19 hijackers were from Egypt.
The 19 hijackers were from Saudi Arabia, Egypt, Lebanon, UAE
One of the 19 hijackers was born in the USA.

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a reason for the September 11th attacks?

choices.answer: Bin Laden believed the US supported the oppression of Muslim
Bin Laden believed the US should support Israel
Bin Laden encouraged his followers to embrace violent jihad
Bin Laden claimed to be righting wrongs against Muslims.

questions.question: Which of the following is a true statement?

choices.answer: The 9-11 Memorial is a cross made from the South Tower
The 9-11 Memorial is the only memorial for the victims
the 9-11 Memorial has waterfalls and a "Survivor Tree"
No plans have been made to build a new World Trade Center.
